triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper applies reward machines to improve reinforcement learning algorithms for better sample efficiency.

triples.name: Finite-state machine
triples.relevance: Reward machines are formalized as a type of finite state machine that specifies reward function structure.

triples.name: Q-learning
triples.relevance: Q-learning is an off-policy reinforcement learning algorithm that the paper uses with reward structure.

triples.name: Linear temporal logic
triples.relevance: Reward machines support temporally extended properties typical of linear temporal logic for non-Markovian rewards.

triples.name: Regular language
triples.relevance: Reward machines have the expressive power of a regular language, supporting loops, sequences, and conditionals.

triples.name: Hierarchical task network
triples.relevance: The paper proposes task decomposition methodologies using reward machines to enable hierarchical learning in reinforcement learning.
